Despite all of the things people say about Megan McCain and the way she doesn't make a good fit on this show, it really made me happy to see a moment like this happen on the View. When Megan started tearing up, I saw extremely genuine tears and I was able to relate because I've watched very close family members as well fighting through cancer and it honestly really is the hardest thing to watch someone go through, especially when you are close to them. Moments like these are magical. Megan and Biden are on opposite sides of the political spectrum but their vast differences of opinions didn't stop them from connecting through this struggle and helping each other gain hope that things will get better someday and to feel better in the moment. This is what we need to do as a nation. Ignore the usual thing that happens on this show where its a democrat vs republican situation because those things do not matter. To get through the crazy storm we call life, we should all come together regardless of our differences and hold out our helping hands. Political parties and opinions divide us, compassion and love will mend us.
